avalancheActivity.highlights: A considerable amount of new snow has accumulated in recent days. The snow cover can be unstable and new wind slabs have formed in variable aspects in isolated areas especially in the high mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow has accumulated in rather light winds, followed by heavy winds in the high mountains in varying directions. Considerable accumulation can be expected in isolated locations. Wind slabs may have formed in gullies and lows in all aspects. The underlying snow underwent a lasting thaw and rain period and is stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hægur vindur og kalt. Hvasst og úrkoma á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: On Sunday and Monday, many small avalanches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð, and three avalanches fell in Súgundafjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small avalanches are possible in the new snow, especially where it has accumulated in gullies. Stormy conditions with warming and additional snowfall may increase the avalanche risk on Thursday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of new snow has accumulated in recent days, especially in gullies and depressions. Wind slabs can be present in all directions.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg vindur og kalt þriðjudag og miðvikudag. Éljagangur á þriðjudag. Hvassviðri og snjókoma á fimmtudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: One rather small avalanche fell in Siglufjarðarskarð by Siglufjörður on Monday 20.01. The avalanche did not reach the ski track.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow is in the area, on top of older wind slabs.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow is in the area. Wind slabs were present before, especially on W-facing aspects. Wind slabs will most likely form on NW-NE aspects in the next few days. Wet avalanches possible on Friday during warm weather. Snow pit from Siglufjörður 21.01. showed stiff wind slab ontop of older stiffer firn,

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.

weatherForecast.highlights: SA-SV áttir og dálítil snjókoma á fimmtudag, mögulega rigning á láglendi. Hlýnar um tíma á fimmtudag. Á föstudag er útlit fyrir að hlýni enn frekar.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches have released in the new snow. Many avalances released during heavy precipitation at the beginning of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the area after snowfall in recent days. Wind slabs could be present on most aspects and chances of wet avalanches at the end of the week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow is in the area after snowfall in recent days. Wind slabs are widely in the mountains and could be on most aspects. Considerable snow is in gullies. A snowpit from Oddsskarð on Jan 26 showes a layered snowpack, which fractured at 20 cm with moderate to hard loading. Thaw at the end of the week with chances of wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow in most places and wind slabs could be present.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg N-V átt fram á fimmtudag þegar snýst í hvassa SA-átt með snjókomu til fjalla um kvöldið en rigningu á láglendi. Á föstudag er útlit fyrir hlýnandi veður, áframhaldandi úrkomu en styttir upp um tíma.
